body:
The PPC64 ELF ABI has a non-executable stack by default, so passing `-Wl,-z,noexecstack` to force the creation of a `GNU_STACK` segment, just so we can assert that it doesn't have the exectable permission, is awkward. Instead, just check that there is no `GNU_STACK` segment in the PPC64 binaries. I would have used `binary.header.machine_type` here, but because this check is generic, and called for all executable types, that wouldn't work, as, for example, the PE binary headers don't have a `machine_type`.

A LIEF issue has been opened upstream: https://github.com/lief-project/LIEF/issues/717.

See the relevant Linux kernel [documentation for powerpc](https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/tree/arch/powerpc/include/asm/page_64.h#n92) (and discussion in #25313):
```c
/*
 * This is the default if a program doesn't have a PT_GNU_STACK
 * program header entry. The PPC64 ELF ABI has a non executable stack
 * stack by default, so in the absence of a PT_GNU_STACK program header
 * we turn execute permission off.
 */
#define VM_STACK_DEFAULT_FLAGS32	VM_DATA_FLAGS_EXEC
#define VM_STACK_DEFAULT_FLAGS64	VM_DATA_FLAGS_NON_EXEC

#define VM_STACK_DEFAULT_FLAGS \
	(is_32bit_task() ? \
	 VM_STACK_DEFAULT_FLAGS32 : VM_STACK_DEFAULT_FLAGS64)
```

title: guix: drop `-z,noexecstack` for PPC64
